title: ‘Freaking out doesn’t help.’ 10 smart things to do right now — instead of panicking about the Dow’s plunge or coronavirus
text: First off, remember to breathe.

title: Indonesia readying measures to stabilize financial markets - finance minister
text: Indonesia Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said on Tuesday that authorities are prepared to use all measures they implemented during the 2008 global financial crisis to stabilize financial markets.

title: Oil prices rebound 6% after rout, but outlook volatile
text: Oil prices bounced around 6% on Tuesday, but analysts saw little chance of a major recovery from the biggest daily rout in nearly 30 years after top producers Saudi Arabia and Russia launched a price war.

title: Barclays cuts 2020 oil price outlook on price war, virus impact
text: Barclays on Tuesday slashed its oil price forecasts for 2020, citing OPEC's failure to convince its allies including Russia to cut production further, which led to Saudi Arabia saying it would raise its output in April despite sluggish global demand.

title: Russia 'smells blood' in the US shale sector, analyst says
text: Thom Payne of Westwood Global Energy Group says the U.S.

title: The Fed’s Main Policy Tool Is Already Effectively Out Of Commission
text: Wall Street is now convinced the Fed will again have to cut interest rates to zero.

title: Oil price drops and coronavirus lead to cratering stock market
text: Lower crude oil prices are supposed to be a good thing. And for drivers and companies that use a lot of fuel they are.

title: Coronavirus hits NYC HQ of Wall Street billionaire Steve Cohen’s hedge fund
text: A spokesperson for Point72 confirmed that an employee at its gleaming new offices at Hudson Yards became a confirmed case of COVID-19 on Monday.

title: As Stock Markets Plunge, Trump Calls for Economic Response to Coronavirus
text: President Trump said his advisers would meet with lawmakers on Tuesday to discuss a potential payroll tax cut and other relief measures as fears of a recession mounted.

title: Oil prices rise 4% after biggest one-day fall since 1991
text: Oil prices rose by more than $1 on Tuesday after a price war by top producers Saudi Arabia and Russia sparked the biggest daily rout since the 1991 Gulf War, but investors saw little chance of a quick price recovery as the coronavirus cuts demand.

title: Gold Futures Rally Hits Price Target Resistance: Watch for Selling
text: Gold futures prices reached up over $1700 last night in trading as the broader financial markets panicked. That rally represented a nice area to take profits or even short into into (for nimble near-term traders).

title: Asia shares slip, stimulus talk offers support
text: Asian markets skidded again on Tuesday after Wall Street suffered its biggest one-day loss since the 2008 financial crisis, but the selling was restrained by hopes for coordinated policy action to quell the panic.

title: Crude Oil Crashes as Fear Index Spikes: Prices to Bottom Soon?
text: Crude Oil Fear Index vs Crude Oil Prices Chart The coronavirus has caused severe economic uncertainty, as economists are beginning to weigh its effect on economic growth.

title: Jim Cramer: Four steps the federal government should take to stave off coronavirus-induced recession
text: "If the President wants to reassure the markets, he needs to consider a new approach — and if he takes it, call me a buyer," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Knowing when to get out of a stock
text: Tim Kane, behavioral economist at Stanford's Hoover Institution, looks at finding the right time to exit a stock.

title: Making sense of market's massive point drop
text: Mona Mahajan, Allianz Global Advisors, tries to make sense of today's market plunge.

title: Yale's Shiller on Economic Fallout From Virus, Fed Policy and Housing
text: Nobel laureate Robert Shiller, Yale University professor of economics, discusses the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak, the Federal Reserve's possible policy response and the state of the housing market.

title: Jim Cramer: Trump needs new coronavirus response approach to reassure the stock market
text: "It's very hard to be constructive about most stocks when the government's focused more on optics than on appropriate precautions," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: White House could offer fiscal stimulus plan tomorrow
text: CNBC's Eamon Javers reports that the White House is considering fiscal stimulus measures to shore up the economy during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Market drops more than 2,000 points, biggest point drop ever
text: Dan Nathan, RiskReversal Advisors, and Kari Firestone, Aureus Asset Management, discuss today's market plunge.

title: A Lot of Damage Has Been Done to Markets, Says JPMorgan's Bob Michelle
text: Mar.09 -- Bob Michele, JPMorgan chief investment officer, talks about how he thinks the Federal Reserve should react to this market sell-off.

title: President teases stimulus package to boost a US economy hit by COVID-19 fears
text: Just a few hours after the markets closed the books on one of its worst trading days since the dawn of the financial crisis, President Donald Trump and members of the coronavirus task force took to the podium in the White House press briefing room to tease an economic stimulus package in an effort to stabilize […]

title: Dow futures up after worst one-day point drop in history
text: Stock prices briefly dropped during premarket trading Monday evening. The after-hours dip followed a massive sell-off Monday prompted by coronavirus fears and an oil price war, which raised questions about whether a recession could be imminent.

title: Investors should sell oil stocks on any rumored OPEC deal, Jim Cramer says
text: "If there's any kind of rumor that the Saudis and the Russians have a new deal to save OPEC and reinstate the old order, I think you use that as a chance to sell," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Robert Shiller: Coronavirus is creating a 'dangerous time' for markets, panic is just starting
text: Nobel-prize winning economist Robert Shiller warns the market meltdown is far from over.

title: We are going to take care of the American public and economy: Trump
text: President Donald Trump and members of his cabinet address the coronavirus outbreak.

title: It's Premature to Call an End to the Bull Market
text: Mike Ryan, UBS global wealth management Americas chief investment officer, says it's too early to call an end to the bull market.

title: Tom Lee explains why bitcoin and crypto market may make sense as hedge when the market is in trouble
text: Thomas Lee, Fundstrat Global Advisors’ Managing Partner and Head of Research, joins The Final Round to discusses investing in crypto amid the coronavirus outbreak while markets are selling off.

title: Circuit breakers, triggered for the first time in 20 years, pass a crucial test
text: Market circuit breakers were tested for the first time since they were substantially revamped more than a decade ago.

title: Searching For A Bottom And A Plan
text: It has been about ten trading days since a large gap developed in the popular US stock market indices.

title: Coronavirus response: Trump floats payroll tax cut, other financial relief amid outbreak
text: President Donald Trump on Monday said he will be meeting with Senate and House Republicans on Tuesday to discuss "a possible tax relief measure" to provide "a timely and effective response to the coronavirus."

title: Oil prices plunge as much as 33%, their biggest drop since the Gulf War
text: Phillip Streible, Chief Market Strategist at Blue Line Futures, joins The Final Round to discuss the oil market, which plunged during Monday’s volatile trading session.

title: Coronavirus warnings could wreak havoc on Florida’s thriving cruise-line economy
text:
Florida is a nerve center for the cruise industry, generating a third of the total dollars in that sector in the U.S.
As cases of the new coronavirus continue to tick up, countless industries are feeling the effects, and the cruise ship business is among the hardest hit.

title: Profits Are Going to Take a Big Hit, Says Jonathan Golub
text: Credit Suisse Group AG’s Jonathan Golub says company earnings are going to take a hit because of the coronavirus.

title: Market Uproar: Stocks Have Worst Day Since Financial Crisis
text: U.S. stocks plunged more than 7.5% in the worst day on Wall Street since the financial crisis, as a full-blown oil price war rattled financial markets already on edge over the spreading coronavirus. Tom Keene, Jonathan Ferro and Lisa Abramowicz wrap up all the action on a special "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Markets continue to sell off on coronavirus fears (Mar 09)
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani and Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth look at what happened today, and key levels to watch.

title: What the credit market is telling us about the possibility of a recession
text: Principal Global Investors' Chief Strategist Seema Shah joins The Final Round to discuss Monday's broad market declines, and what, if anything, can be done to mitigate further retraction.

title: Gold hits 7-year high, is now the time to buy?
text: Bill Baruch, Blue Line Futures, on gold's recent move. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Steve Grasso, Karen Finerman and Guy Adami.

title: Coronavirus Vs. 2008 Financial Crisis
text: The spread of the coronavirus is undoubtedly going to continue, but will this lead to an economic downturn?

title: White House considers possible stimulus package over market plunge
text: CNBC's Eamon Javers reports the White House is considering implementing a stimulus package to calm the markets.

title: Putin may challenge US shale industry: Former Shell Oil president
text: Former Shell Oil President John Hofmeister provides insight into the Russia-Saudi price war sending oil prices plummeting amid coronavirus anxiety.

title: Oil sell-off deepens as prices slip further following worst day since 1991
text: Oil prices slid deeper into correction territory in early trading, after posting the steepest losses since 1991 on Monday.

title: Canaccord's Tony Dwyer on today's plunge
text: Canaccord Genuity's Tony Dwyer looks at today's big market drop. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Steve Grasso, Karen Finerman and Guy Adami.

title: Dow futures fall more than 200 points following the market's worst day since the financial crisis
text: Stock futures fell in overnight trading Monday, pointing to more trouble ahead after the S&P 500's worst day since the financial crisis.

title: Markets Crumble on Oil Shock, Virus Fears
text: Kristen Bitterly of Citi Private Bank, Nisha Patel of Parametric and Priya Misra of TD Securities discuss the global market sell-off amid a plunge in oil prices over the weekend and fears over the coronavirus outbreak.

title: On the Edge of a Bear Market
text: Plummeting oil prices and a jump in coronavirus infections leaves stocks teetering on the edge of a bear market   This will be remembered as an historic day in the investment markets. Stocks collapsed as investors panicked over crashing oil prices and the spreading coronavirus.

title: Jim Cramer says he could see '9 or 10' oil companies going bankrupt if crude declines persist
text: "I feel better about the banks than I do any oil company," CNBC's Jim Cramer said Monday.

title: Here are the milestones and firsts from the markets' historically bad day
text: The Dow, energy sector and Treasury yields all made history on Monday.

title: US Indexes Fall Monday, Stock Trading Halted (Mar 09)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 23,851.02 on Monday with a loss of 2,013.76 points or 7.79%.

title: Summers Says U.S. Recession Is More Likely Than Not
text: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers, a Bloomberg contributor, discusses the efforts by U.S. policymakers to offset the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak, the emergency Federal Reserve rate cut, and the odds of a U.S. recession. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets."
